decks.notes: The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Murktide Regent. The deck aims to control the game tempo by efficiently removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Psychic Frog, while utilizing cards like Thought Scour and Cling to Dust to dig for key pieces. By establishing board dominance with creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Harbinger of the Seas, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until achieving victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive early game plays while disrupting the opponent's strategy through cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus. The creatures in the deck, such as Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk, help apply pressure on the opponent while providing additional utility. Ephemerate and Flickerwisp allow for powerful synergies and tricks to outmaneuver the opponent. The deck's versatile mana base ensures consistent access to its powerful spells and creatures, enabling a proactive game plan that aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and burn spells. With cards like Ajani, Ragavan, and Phlage, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Arena of Glory provides additional power boost, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge offer direct damage to finish off the opponent. Static Prison and Elegant Parlor help control the opponent's board, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. It also aims to control the board with powerful removal spells and disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp. The deck utilizes a combination of mana fixing lands and versatile creatures to outvalue opponents and maintain a strong board presence. Overall, the deck combines aggression and disruption to create a challenging and versatile playstyle in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck revolves around utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy to trigger powerful abilities on creatures and artifacts while also generating card advantage. By abusing the activated abilities of cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble, the deck can create a loop of actions that can lead to explosive turns and potentially win the game in just a few swings. The key strategy is to continuously loop through your deck to find key pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan while building an overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate mana quickly, enabling the player to cheat out powerful cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing lands that can tap for multiple mana or produce additional lands, the deck can ramp up to their win conditions faster than traditional ramp decks. The combination of land untapping effects, powerful land cards, and efficient tutors allows the player to assemble their combo pieces quickly and overwhelm their opponent with massive threats.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence through aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, supported by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. Leyline Binding and Scion of Draco provide additional control and protection, while Leyline of the Guildpact boosts the power of the deck's multicolored threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and versatile spells, backed up by powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to use low-cost aggressive creatures and disruption spells to put pressure on the opponent quickly. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize while deploying threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Emperor of Bones to close out the game efficiently. Utilizing Eldrazi creatures and powerful land cards like Urza's Saga, this Mono Black Aggro deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent early on and maintain momentum throughout the match.

The deck focuses on generating mana through rituals and medallions to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. It utilizes cards like Manamorphose and Reckless Impulse to cycle through the deck and find key combo pieces. Past in Flames allows for recursion of spells from the graveyard, while Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot serve as the primary win conditions. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and go off in a explosive turn to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and damage.
